CNN.com Student News Newsletter






 
Tuesday, May 8, 2007



 Watch and Learn 
Today's edition of CNN Student News starts off with a description of recovery efforts in a tornado-ravaged town in Kansas. Then, we report on a plane crash in Africa. And we set the table for a state dinner at the White House.Teachers, we want to hear your opinions about CNN Student News. Fill out our end-of-the-year survey, and let us know what you think.

 Morehouse president steps down after 12 years 
Walter Massey was a shy, black boy from Hattiesburg, Mississippi, unsure of his place in the world, when he arrived as a 16-year-old freshman at Morehouse College. Massey, who turned 69 in April, steps down as president on June 30. Robert Franklin -- an Emory University professor, former president of the Interdenominational Theological Center in Atlanta and a 1975 Morehouse graduate -- has been named Morehouse's 10th president.


 
CNN Student News is a 10-minute, commercial-free news program that airs on CNN Headline News at 3:12 a.m. EST as well as on CNN.com/EDUCATION. Created by a team of journalists and educators, the program provides the top stories of the day, segments that encourage student participation, and in-depth special reports. In addition, CNN Student News provides free curriculum at CNN.com/EDUCATION to accompany each program's content. CNN Student News, along with CNN Classroom Edition, is Turner Broadcasting's contribution to Cable in the Classroom.
